name: Robotex
description: Life on Earth is unsustainable. Humanity must seek a new home but the only planet found is very hostile. You were sent on a expedition to slay the monsters inhabiting the surface of this planet. In this adventure you end up being the villain. Game contains two basic controls, many puzzles and lots of guns and enemies.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1 Processor: 2.0 GHz Memory: 2000 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 240 (or better) DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 1 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1 Processor: 3.0 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 240 (or better) DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: It boggles my mind, how a game can be so visually appealing, and yet its interface and controls to be made with foot scribbles. Make a redux version, and include this one in the price at most or remove this one from Steam. And get a bloody UI designer.
The best time I had with this crap was when I uninstalled it.
A fairly mundane platformer type game that was 19c.   Worth about that.

It's like Flappy Bird except with the additional stress of having to kill enemies, and actually distinguish hazardous obstacles from the background environment. Nice graphics, but too frustrating to play.
This godawful sh*t of a game took 9 hrs to drop cards.

Very colourful, yet almost totally unplayable platformer. Maybe the fans of Super Meat Boy wanna new challenge, fighting gloomy interface and pointless gameplay? Otherwise, the only reason why someone buys this game, of course, it's the Steam cards! Although, they are not so high, so even with 90% discount you can't be sure that you'll be in the black.  'Don't buy if you can't to stress' - says one of the screenshots on the store page. Not sure what that means, but I think you got the message. Don't Buy. Even with discount. It is not worth your time, at all. Mark 2.5/10 - only for nice looking screenshots.

Poor controls, inconsistant, unclear art, low quality audio and terrible level design combine to make this a game to avoid. There are some fun artistic desings and it has some interesting weapon variety that you can choose from the start. Its definitely not enough to save the game from being an overall bad product.

This game is only worth getting if the price of the Steam trading cards outweigh the cost of the game. Fortunately that is pretty easy to do during the large Steam sales as the game can be had for around 20 cents.  Gameplay is overly difficult but not because it has a high skill ceilling. There is practically zero information conveyed to the player about goals, objectives, or how to play. You have to just interpret what you think the game is asking of you based on the icons that show up on the various 'menu' pages. Nothing on this game has any polish. It actually looks like something made for a bet or a school project.  2/10 because it does technically work. Get your steam cards and move on.  Edit: I only started to receive the Steam trading cards after the 2 hour refund window had passed. YMMV.
